nodes.label: Result
nodes.content: Feature selection methods based on importance values outperformed SHAP value-based methods.

nodes.label: Finding
nodes.content: XGBoost with feature subset size 3 outperformed SHAP-XGBoost.

nodes.label: Finding
nodes.content: SHAP-XGBoost with feature subset size 10 outperformed XGBoost.

nodes.label: Finding
nodes.content: CatBoost outperformed SHAP-CatBoost for feature subsets 3 to 10.

nodes.label: Finding
nodes.content: A tie between CatBoost and SHAP-CatBoost at feature subset size 15.

nodes.label: Finding
nodes.content: ANOVA results show significant differences among groups.

nodes.label: Result
nodes.content: Importance-based feature selection significantly outperformed SHAP-based methods.

nodes.label: Conclusion
nodes.content: Importance-based feature selection methods are recommended for larger datasets.

nodes.label: Discussion
nodes.content: Importance-based methods are more suitable for high-dimensional data.

nodes.label: Future Research
nodes.content: Exploration of feature selection methods across diverse domains is suggested.
